message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with image interpolation, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The use of sparse representation and a selected dictionary for promoting sparsity suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The iterative thresholding step also suggests a possible connection to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. The use of high frequency information and the comparison to state-of-the-art methods suggests a possible connection to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. The use of a shearlet dictionary suggests a possible connection to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category, as shearlets have been used in machine learning applications. Finally, the use of objective and subjective performance metrics suggests a possible connection to the cs.SI (Signal and Image Processing) sub-category.
